intro: Reseda amblycarpa var. somala, commonly known as the Somalian reseda, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. This species is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-desert environments.
